original: AMEL.N, Sture, Ingenjör, Stockholm, f Sthlm 5/1 11 av ing R A o Ella Zethrin, gm Eina Backlund. Studex, CTI. Anst Sy Ackumulator AB Jungner 35, styr.suppl där. °AMINOFF, Gregor Berndt, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Sthlm 19/7 99 av roteman B A o Hilda Cederberg, gm Daga Berg. Studex Sthlm 17, KTH (V o V) 17—21. Konstr v Byggnadskonstruktionsbyrån (prof C Forssell) sed. 21 o deläg i fman sed. 32. Assist i byggn.statik v KTH 21—29 o 32. Led Sv Konsult Ing:s Frn. AMNÉUS, Ernst Helmer, Konsul, Sundsvall, f Hede, Jämtl, 2/8 72 av skogsch K S A o Eva Arnlöf, gm Henny Erlandsen. Hu-diksv lärov, kem.tekn stud Sthlm, Köpenhamn 0 Tyskl 89—92, språkstud. Ch eng fma på Elfenbenskusten, Västafrika, 92—95, försäljn.ch o förv Holmsunds AB 96, d:o dettas Sdsv-avd 02. Eg agentur- o expfma i trävarubran-schen, Ernst H Amnéus, Sdsv, sed. 06, avd.-kont Gbg o Luleå 15—21. Eng v. kons f Umeå distr 02, amerik kons f Norrl 08. Bat.cn f Sdsv ö Istbat und mob 14, ordf Sdsv Istfrn 12—15. Resor: Danm, Tyskl, österr-Ung, Schweiz, Frankr 90—92, Engl o Västafr 92— 95, vidstr res i mell o s Europ o Egypt 07— 16. Av trycket: »Hos Kung Bålle o andra negerhövdingar» (34). Sdsv Istfrn M; Frimurare, Odd Fellow, W6. Hobbies: Flugfiske, skidåkning, eng o amerik litteratur.
translated:
AMEN.N, Sture, Engineer, Stockholm, born in Stockholm on January 5th, 1911, son of engineer R A and Ella Zethrin, married to Eina Backlund. Studied at CTI. Employed at Sy Ackumulator AB Jungner in 1935, later became a supervisory board member. 

AMINOFF, Gregor Berndt, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, born in Stockholm on July 19th, 1899, son of sergeant B A and Hilda Cederberg, married to Daga Berg. Studied at Stockholm 17 and KTH (V o V) from 1917 to 1921. Worked as a designer at Byggnadskonstruktionsbyrån (under the supervision of professor C Forssell) since 1921 and became a partner in the company in 1932. Assistant in building statics at KTH from 1921 to 1929 and 1932. Member of the Swedish Consulting Engineers Association. 

AMNÉUS, Ernst Helmer, Consul, Sundsvall, born in Hede, Jämtland on August 2nd, 1872, son of forest manager K S A and Eva Arnlöf, married to Henny Erlandsen. Educated at Hudiksvalls läroverk, studied chemical technology in Stockholm and Copenhagen from 1889 to 1892, and language studies in England from 1892 to 1895. Worked in sales and management at Holmsunds AB in 1896, and at its Sundsvall branch in 1902. Established his own agency and export company in the timber industry, Ernst H Amnéus, in Sundsvall in 1906, with branches in Gothenburg and Luleå from 1915 to 1921. Honorary consul to the United States in the Umeå district from 1902, American consul in northern Sweden from 1908. Served in the South Swedish Infantry Battalion during East Coast conflicts in 1914, Chairman of the South Swedish Infantry Association from 1912 to 1915. Traveled to Denmark, Germany, Austria-Hungary, Switzerland, France in 1890-1892, England and West Africa in 1892-1895, extensive travels in Central and Southern Europe, as well as Egypt, from 1907 to 1916. Published "Hos Kung Bålle and other tribal chiefs" (1934). Member of the South Swedish Infantry Association; Freemason, Odd Fellow, W6. Hobbies: Fly fishing, skiing, English and American literature.

publications.name: Hos Kung Bålle and other tribal chiefs
